definitions.definition: A close-fitting hat , either brimless or peaked .
examples: The children were all wearing caps to protect them from the sun.

definitions.definition: A special hat to indicate rank , occupation , etc.
An academic mortarboard .
A protective cover or seal .
examples: He took the cap off the bottle and splashed himself with some cologne.

definitions.definition: A crown for covering a tooth .
examples: He had golden caps on his teeth.

definitions.definition: The summit of a mountain , etc.
examples: There was snow on the cap of the mountain.

definitions.definition: An artificial upper limit or ceiling .
examples: We should put a cap on the salaries, to keep them under control.

definitions.definition: The top part of a mushroom .
( toy ) A small amount of percussive explosive in a paper strip or plastic cup for use in a toy gun .
examples: Billy spent all morning firing caps with his friends, re-enacting storming the beach at Normandy.

definitions.definition: A small explosive device used to detonate a larger charge of explosives.
examples: He wired the cap to the bundle of dynamite, then detonated it remotely.

definitions.definition: ( slang ) A bullet used to shoot someone.
( slang , originally African-American Vernacular ) A lie or exaggeration .
( sports ) A place on a national team; an international appearance .
examples: Rio Ferdinand won his 50th cap for England in a game against Sweden.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) The top, or uppermost part; the chief.
( obsolete ) A respectful uncovering of the head.
( zoology ) The whole top of the head of a bird from the base of the bill to the nape of the neck .
( architecture ) The uppermost of any assemblage of parts.
examples: the cap of a column, door, etc.; a capital, coping, cornice, lintel, or plate

definitions.definition: Something covering the top or end of a thing for protection or ornament.
( nautical ) A collar of iron or wood used in joining spars, as the mast and the topmast, the bowsprit and the jib boom; also, a covering of tarred canvas at the end of a rope.
( geometry ) A portion of a spherical or other convex surface.
A large size of writing paper.
examples: flat cap ; fools cap ; legal cap

definitions.definition: ( Appalachia ) Popcorn.

definitions.definition: ( finance ) Capitalization .
( informal ) A capital letter .
( electronics ) A capacitor .
examples: I had to replace the caps in that thing to get it to work again.

definitions.definition: ( colloquial ) A recording or screenshot .( shortening of "capture" ).
examples: Anyone have a cap of the games last night?

definitions.definition: ( slang ) A capsule of a drug.
( colloquial ) A capitalist .
( anatomy ) A capillary .
A caption .

definitions.definition: A wooden drinking - bowl with two handles .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) A wooden drinking - bowl with two handles .
